name: expurgation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of removing parts of a piece of writing that are considered likely to cause offence, or a piece of writing that has had parts removed like this: The publication now undergoes a great deal of expurgation. Thomas Bowdler published expurgations of Shakespeare for family reading. See
expurgate
More examplesFewer examplesThe version of the novel in circulation for many years was the expurgation by the author’s sister.The editor was criticized for the deliberate expurgation of content from the published diaries.The jury heard the story with some expurgation.
